intro: Tabernaemontana berteroi var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered star of India, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in warm climates for its striking floral display.
